intro: Brickellia problematica, commonly known as the Mexican brickellbush, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Brickellia problematica is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
